Package com.intellij.testFramework

Class LightVirtualFileBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.util.UserDataHolderBase
      • com.intellij.openapi.vfs.VirtualFile
        • com.intellij.testFramework.LightVirtualFileBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModificationTracker, UserDataHolder, UserDataHolderEx
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryLightVirtualFile, LightVirtualFile

    public abstract class LightVirtualFileBase
extends VirtualFile
    In-memory implementation of VirtualFile.

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        Gets the path of this file. Path is a string that uniquely identifies a file within a given VirtualFileSystem. Format of the path depends on the concrete file system. For LocalFileSystem it is an absolute file path with file separator characters (File.separatorChar) replaced to the forward slash ('/').
        Specified by:
        getPath in class VirtualFile
        Returns:
        the path

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        Checks whether this file could be modified. Note that this value may be cached and may differ from write permission of the physical file.
        Specified by:
        isWritable in class VirtualFile
        Returns:
        true if this file is writable, false otherwise

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        Checks whether this VirtualFile is valid. File can be invalidated either by deleting it or one of its parents with VirtualFile.delete(java.lang.Object) method or by an external change. If file is not valid only Object.equals(java.lang.Object), Object.hashCode(), VirtualFile.getName(), VirtualFile.getPath(), VirtualFile.getUrl(), VirtualFile.getPresentableUrl() and methods from UserDataHolder can be called for it. Using any other methods for an invalid VirtualFile instance produce unpredictable results.
        Specified by:
        isValid in class VirtualFile
        Returns:
        true if this is a valid file, false otherwise

      • getModificationStamp

        public long getModificationStamp()
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        Gets modification stamp value. Modification stamp is a value changed by any modification of the content of the file. Note that it is not related to the file modification time.
        Overrides:
        getModificationStamp in class VirtualFile
        Returns:
        modification stamp
        See Also:
        VirtualFile.getTimeStamp()

      • refresh

        public void refresh(boolean asynchronous,
                    boolean recursive,
                    java.lang.Runnable postRunnable)
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        The same as VirtualFile.refresh(boolean, boolean) but also runs postRunnable after the operation is completed. The runnable is executed on event dispatch thread inside write action.
        Specified by:
        refresh in class VirtualFile

      • rename

        public void rename(java.lang.Object requestor,
                   java.lang.String newName)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile

        Renames this file to the newName.

        This method should only be called within write action.

        Overrides:
        rename in class VirtualFile
        Parameters:
        requestor - any object to control who called this method. Note that it is considered to be an external change if requestor is null. See VirtualFileEvent.getRequestor()
        newName - the new file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file failed to be renamed

      • createChildDirectory

        public VirtualFile createChildDirectory(java.lang.Object requestor,
                                        java.lang.String name)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        Creates a subdirectory in this directory. This method should be only called within write-action. See Application.runWriteAction(java.lang.Runnable).
        Overrides:
        createChildDirectory in class VirtualFile
        Parameters:
        requestor - any object to control who called this method. Note that it is considered to be an external change if requestor is null. See VirtualFileEvent.getRequestor()
        name - directory name
        Returns:
        VirtualFile representing the created directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if directory failed to be created
